alert.note: Alert for Clark; Ford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 27 at 7:54PM CDT until April 27 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Ford County in southwestern Kansas... Clark County in southwestern Kansas... * Until 845 PM CDT. * At 754 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles south of Ft. Dodge to near Clark State Lake to 10 miles northwest of Acres, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Clark State Lake and Kingsdown around 800 PM CDT. Acres around 810 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ford, Ashland, Bucklin and Sitka. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
